intro: Microlicia inundata, commonly known as the water microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in wet, swampy environments and is often found in marshes and along riverbanks. Due to its unique habitat and floral structure, it plays a role in supporting local pollinators and aquatic ecosystems.
